intro: Gonolobus lasiostemma, commonly known as the rough-stemmed gonolobus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open woodland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its seeds are encased in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years, contributing to its persistence in natural ecosystems. The species is also noted for its potential ecological importance in supporting local insect and bird populations.
